snippet: Three members of the Federal Reserve’s policy-making committee indicated that recent data, while troubling, does not yet justify an expansion of the Fed’s economic aid campaign.
abstract: Three members of the Federal Reserve’s policy-making committee indicate that recent economic data, while troubling, does not yet justify an expansion of the Fed’s economic aid campaign; remarks suggest that the committee will give more consideration to such an expansion, but also that Fed officials remain uncertain whether the nation's growth has slowed.
lead_paragraph: Three members of the Federal Reserve’s policy-making committee indicated that recent data, while troubling, does not yet justify an expansion of the Fed’s economic aid campaign.

headline.seo: Federal Reserve Members See No Need to Act Now
headline.main: A Little Optimism at the Federal Reserve
headline.print_headline: A Little Optimism at the Federal Reserve
